clusters.title: Shock CCTV shows moment man is snatched off the street in Sydney
clusters.neutral_headline: CCTV Shows Alleged Kidnapping in Sydney

items.title: Shock CCTV shows moment man is snatched off the street in Sydney
items.standfirst: T he man was allegedly held captive for four days as his family received ransom demands and police raced to find him.
items.content: Shocking CCTV has emerged of the moment a man was abducted on a suburban street in Sydney's south-west.The footage shows a white SUV pulling up before three people get out of the car.The trio physically apprehended a man who was on his way to the gym and bundled him into the car.READ MORE: Man accused of assaulting woman in wheelchair The man was then allegedly held captive for four days.9News initially became aware of the incident on Thursday last week, but complied with a police request not to broadcast it due to operational reasons.In the four days of the man's captivity, police established a strike force to investigate the incident and determine his location.READ MORE: Man accused of assaulting woman in wheelchairIt's also been alleged that the victim's family received ransom demands.The man , who 9News understands was not known to police, has now been released.The three suspects seen on the CCTV footage remain on the run.DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

items.standfirst: CCTV has shown the moment a Sydney man was allegedly bundled into a car, the start of a four-day captivity.
items.content: CCTV has shown the moment a Sydney man was allegedly bundled into a car, the start of a four-day captivity.

ai_summary: CCTV captured the moment of an alleged kidnapping.
A man was allegedly taken off the street.
The man was held captive for four days.
Ransom demands were made to the family.
Police were involved in the search.

clusters.title: Israel receives supposed remains of three more deceased hostages from Gaza
clusters.neutral_headline: Remains of Three Israeli Hostages Returned from Gaza
bullet_summary: If confirmed that the bodies are those of three Israeli hostages, that would leave the bodies of eight deceased hostages remaining in Gaza

items.title: Israel receives supposed remains of three more deceased hostages from Gaza
items.standfirst: If confirmed that the bodies are those of three Israeli hostages, that would leave the bodies of eight deceased hostages remaining in Gaza.
items.content: Israel on Sunday received the remains of what Hamas said are three more deceased hostages held in Gaza.The remains were transferred to Israel via the Red Cross and will be taken to the country's national forensics laboratory for identification.If confirmed that the bodies are those of three Israeli hostages, that would leave the bodies of eight deceased hostages remaining in Gaza.READ MORE: UK train stabbing suspect released as 'hero' fights for lifeThe latest transfer of remains comes after Hamas handed over the bodies of two deceased hostages on Thursday evening, identified as Amiram Cooper, 84, and Sahar Baruch, 25.Hamas had also handed over the remains of three deceased individuals over the weekend, but they were not identified as belonging to any of the deceased hostages, an Israeli official said on Saturday.Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Sunday that Israel is committed to ensuring the return of all the deceased hostages.READ MORE: Eight minutes to put 11 in hospital: What's known about UK train stabbingSpeaking at the weekly cabinet meeting, Netanyahu accused Hamas of "pathetic attempts to deceive us, the United States, and the world."They will, of course, fail, and we will gradually bring back all our hostages."He added that Israel is still operating against "Hamas pockets" in Rafah and Khan Younis, areas that are under IDF control, "and we are systematically eliminating them."DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

items.title: Remains of three more Israeli hostages returned
items.standfirst: If confirmed that the bodies are those of three Israeli hostages, that would leave the bodies of eight deceased hostages remaining in Gaza.
items.content: If confirmed that the bodies are those of three Israeli hostages, that would leave the bodies of eight deceased hostages remaining in Gaza.

ai_summary: The remains of three Israeli hostages were returned.
The bodies were recovered from Gaza.
Eight deceased hostages remain in Gaza.
The remains are awaiting confirmation.
The families have been notified.

clusters.title: Police say British man only suspect in train attack, praise 'heroic' staff
clusters.neutral_headline: London Train Stabbing Investigation Focuses on Single Suspect

items.title: Police say British man only suspect in train attack, praise 'heroic' staff
items.standfirst: British police are not treating a mass stabbing attack on a London-bound train as an act of terror. It left at least 11 people in hospital, some in critical condition.
items.content: British police are not treating a mass stabbing attack on a London-bound train as an act of terror. It left at least 11 people in hospital, some in critical condition.

items.title: UK train stabbing suspect released as 'hero' fights for life
items.standfirst: A British national remains in custody as the sole suspect over the devastating attack that put 11 in hospital.
items.content: One of the men initially arrested over a mass stabbing on a train near Cambridge in the UK has been released without charge, after police confirmed the attack is not being considered a terrorist incident.Of the 11 people rushed to hospital following the alleged attack on board a train from Doncaster to King's Cross in London last night (early this morning AEDT), one is still in a critical condition.British Transport Police Superintendent John Loveless told a press conference this morning (overnight AEDT) that four of the victims had been discharged and two men had been arrested on suspicion of attempted murder.READ MORE: Witnesses recall stabbing victims fleeing through carriages in terror on UK train They were a 32-year-old black British man and a 35-year-old British man of Caribbean descent, both born in the UK, who'd been arrested within eight minutes of the first emergency call, he said.However, authorities have since said only the 32-year-old remains in custody, after the 35-year-old was released without charge. "At this stage, there is nothing to suggest that this is a terrorist incident," Loveless said, adding it would be inappropriate to speculate on the cause.Ten people, nine initially believed to be suffering life-threatening injuries, were taken to hospital after the incident and one more self-reported later, the superintendent said. There have been no fatalities recorded. One victim remains in a life-threatening condition – a member of train staff whom police say saved lives with his "heroic" actions.READ MORE: UK mass train stabbing: What we know about horrific attackMajor incident declared Police had earlier declared a major incident and counter-terrorism officers were initially helping with the investigation, but no motive had been confirmed."This is a shocking incident and first and foremost my thoughts are with those who have been injured this evening and their families," Chief Superintendent Chris Casey said earlier."We're conducting urgent enquiries to establish what has happened, and it could take some time before we are in a position to confirm anything further.READ MORE: Man charged with murder after woman found dead in Hunter Valley home "At this early stage it would not be appropriate to speculate on the causes of the incident."Our response is ongoing at the station and will be for some time."Cordons are in place and trains are not currently running through the area, and there are also some road closures.""Plato" was declared initially - the UK code word used by emergency services when responding to a "marauding terror attack" - before it was later rescinded.British Transport Police previously said on X that officers were "responding to an incident on a train to Huntingdon where multiple people have been stabbed”.Cambridgeshire Constabulary, the local police force, said armed police attended after officers were called to the scene at Huntingdon Station at 7.42pm on Saturday (6.42am Sunday AEDT).The two people were arrested at the station, which is about 120 kilometres north of London.The train was the 6.25pm service travelling from Doncaster to London King's Cross , British Transport Police confirmed."Armed officers attended and the train was stopped at Huntingdon, where two men were arrested. A number of people have been taken to hospital," Cambridge Police said in a statement.Politicians describe 'deeply concerning', 'horrendous scenes' Paul Bristow, the mayor of Cambridgeshire and Peterborough, said in a post on X he had heard of reports of “horrendous scenes” on the train.British Prime Minister Keir Starmer called the incident "deeply concerning"."My thoughts are with all those affected, and my thanks go to the emergency services for their response. Anyone in the area should follow the advice of the police," he said on X.https://x.com/Keir_Starmer/status/1984743058856869942British Home Secretary Shabana Mahmood said she was "deeply saddened to hear about the stabbings", and that her "thoughts go out to all those affected"."Two suspects have been immediately arrested and taken into custody," she said in a post on X.Mahmood said she was receiving regular updates on the investigation and urged people to avoid "speculation at this early stage" as to what was behind the stabbings.Conservative party leader Kemi Badenoch also responded to the incident in a post on X."This is an absolutely horrific attack and my thoughts are with all those affected including the emergency responders at the scene," Badenoch wrote.The East Coast Main Line is one of the UK's busiest and most important railway routes.It connects major cities, running from London King's Cross to Edinburgh Waverley in Scotland.David Horne, managing director of train firm LNER, said the operator was "deeply shocked and saddened by the serious incident".He said passengers should check before travelling.Earlier, the company told train passengers not to travel. - With additional details by CNN and Associated Press DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

ai_summary: A British man is the only suspect in the London train stabbing incident.
The attack on the train left at least eleven people hospitalized.
Some of the injured are in critical condition following the attack.
Authorities are not treating the incident as an act of terrorism.
A "hero" who intervened is fighting for their life after the attack.

items.standfirst: At least two people have been killed in a drone attack in Ukraine's south-western Odesa region, and Kyiv has stepped up its attacks on Russia's oil industry.
items.content: At least two people have been killed in a drone attack in Ukraine's south-western Odesa region, and Kyiv has stepped up its attacks on Russia's oil industry.

ai_summary: Russian drones killed Ukrainians in Odesa region.
Kyiv has increased attacks on Russia's oil industry.
At least two people died in the drone attack.
The attacks are part of the ongoing conflict.
The situation remains highly volatile.

clusters.title: Each day, these football-owned poker machines rake in more than $300k
clusters.neutral_headline: Football-Owned Poker Machines Generate Large Revenue
bullet_summary: There are calls for football teams to distance themselves from poker machines after data found more than $110 million was lost at venues owned by football clubs and leagues in the last financial year

clusters.title: 'Found our voice': Nationals abandon net zero by 2050 climate promise
clusters.neutral_headline: Australian Nationals Abandon Net Zero Emissions Commitment

items.title: 'Found our voice': Nationals abandon net zero by 2050 climate promise
items.standfirst: The Nationals have formally abandoned a commitment to reach net zero emissions by 2050, setting a challenge for Opposition leader Sussan Ley whether to follow or risk splitting the Coalition.
items.content: The Nationals have formally abandoned a commitment to reach net zero emissions by 2050, setting a challenge for Opposition leader Sussan Ley whether to follow or risk splitting the Coalition.

ai_summary: The Nationals have abandoned their commitment to net zero emissions by 2050.
This decision presents a challenge for Opposition leader Sussan Ley.
Ley must decide whether to follow or risk splitting the Coalition.
The Nationals' shift could impact Australia's climate change policies.
The move signals a potential change in the Coalition's environmental stance.

clusters.title: India claims maiden World Cup title with epic victory over South Africa
clusters.neutral_headline: India Wins Cricket World Cup Against South Africa

items.title: India claims maiden World Cup title with epic victory over South Africa
items.standfirst: All-round performances from Deepti Sharma and Shafali Verma have led India to a breakthrough World Cup triumph against South Africa in Navi Mumbai.
items.content: All-round performances from Deepti Sharma and Shafali Verma have led India to a breakthrough World Cup triumph against South Africa in Navi Mumbai.

ai_summary: India secured a World Cup title with a victory over South Africa.
Deepti Sharma and Shafali Verma delivered strong all-around performances.
The match took place in Navi Mumbai, India.
India's win marks a significant achievement in cricket.
The victory is a breakthrough for the Indian team.
